sect2.title: Introduction to PSUtils
sect2.para: PSUtils is a set of utilities to manipulate PostScript files.

sect2.title: Installation of PSUtils
sect2.para: Install PSUtils by running the following commands:

userinput.command: cat Makefile.unix | sed -e 's|/usr/local|/usr|g' > Makefile && make && make install

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: cat Makefile.unix | sed -e ... > Makefile: This command creates a Makefile that installs the program to the /usr prefix instead of the /usr/local prefix.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The PSUtils package contains psbook, psselect, pstops, psnup, psresize, epsffit, getafm, showchar, fixdlsrps, fixfmps, fixmacps, fixpsditps, fixpspps, fixscribeps, fixtpps, fixwfwps, fixwpps, fixwwps, extractres, includeres and psmerge.

Sometimes psnup and other utilities from this package produce PostScript files that don't conform to Adobe's DSC standard. CUPS may print them incorrectly. On the other hand, CUPS has builtin replacements for most commands from this package. For example, to print a document 2-up, you can issue this command:

sect3.title: psselect
sect3.para: psselect selects pages and page ranges.

sect3.title: pstops
sect3.para: pstops performs general page rearrangements and selection.

sect3.title: psnup
sect3.para: psnup puts multiple pages per physical sheet of paper.

sect3.title: psresize
sect3.para: psresize alters the document paper size.

sect3.title: epsffit
sect3.para: epsffit fits an EPSF file to a given bounding box.

sect3.title: scripts
sect3.para: The remaining commands are scripts that perform specific functions described in their respective man pages.
